Docs.summary: Indicates how an animation should behave when animating a time outside of its defined timeline.
Docs.remarks: For example, if an animation has a duration of 10 seconds, but we allow the animation to play to 11 seconds, how should the animation behave in that case?

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype GameStack.Graphics.AnimationBehavior Constant = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Clamp the time to the ending time (or beginning time), effectively freezing the animation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype GameStack.Graphics.AnimationBehavior Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Use the default node transformation (reverts model to original position).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype GameStack.Graphics.AnimationBehavior Linear = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The value of the nearest two keys is extrapolated (continues current motion).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype GameStack.Graphics.AnimationBehavior Repeat = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Play the animation repeatedly (time mod duration).
